Holy shit you are blowing this out of proportion. It's not the end of the world because champions with shields get a decent rune, calm down. 

First of all, there are 2 runes that work on champs without shields, the other 2 in the fucking row. Font of Life is a Tank/Support rune, that's fine. Demolish is your alternative, and if you don't see the value in it then that's your problem. With the new Tower Plates granting gold each time one of them is destroyed, and with the charge time buff on Demolish, the rune is very good for gaining gold advantages because you can quickly kill a plate and leave, that and the outer towers lose defense after the 14 min, making Demolish hit even harder. If you are really afraid of losing trades, then do something different with the trade and get better.

You seem to be under the impression that Shield Bash has a fuck ton of damage and that any tanks who take it will win every trade. If this is your assumption, you are completely wrong. I've played against it and with it on the PBE and the damage is okay. Better on some champions than others, but it is by no means an auto win for tanks or any fighters who take it. Even late game the damage is not insane, when you take into account armor and MR, this is especially true for tanks because they will not have Armor and MR penetration. On a fighter you could get a little more value, and for reference I have tested this on Riven, and at level 3, Shield bash was doing a little over 20 before reductions, making it do comparable damage to Scorch and Cheap Shot, hardly a broken rune.

It doesn't "work against creeps". The description says "next basic attack against a champion", within 4s of gaining the shield (you could even kill a few creeps and keep the buff).

 It may or may not turn out to be an effective option for ranged champions, but pretty clearly, this was the kind of interaction that the sponsors of this Rune were going for. The possibility for a champion to buy into Resolve (especially now that stat bonuses are seperate) - Extra damage on rapidly decaying shields like Overheal, and supports with spammable shields providing benefit even when there was no obvious reason to use the shield. Overheal gave value to heal procs at full health, and Shield Bash gives value to shield procs with no damage to mitigate. With Overheal feeding into Shield Bash.

Overheal reduced the factor of restraint in heals. Shield Bash reduces the need for restraint in shielding.

With Overheal, the support doesn't need to save Relic Shield for when the ADC is low. Instead, with the Shield, the ADC can try for a play.

With Shield Bash, I might not wait to cast the Shield when the ADC is actually threatened. I might cast to increase his damage. It's not a lot, but it's not insignificant either, and it can add up.

And since it synergizes with several other mechanics it could be viable. Now that the shielding is increased %10, it might even be worse. Not for oppressive late game damage. But for an unpleasant amount of increased sustain in laning. I'm still thinking about dual relic shield bottom lanes with Overheal. But with this rune you don't even need the ADC to wear relic to make it work.

When the dual relic strategy was meta earlier this year, the ADC did not take Sorcery secondary. The ADC went Resolve, to get the Revitalize buff. (The support also took Revitalize.)

You're right about the Sorcery Secondary runes - in low mmr Gathering Storm can be a beast. The game doesn't calculate damage contribution from all runes the same way (I wish that it did).  But by 30m, that's probably around %10 more AD. If you take the rune, and the game goes long, it will contribute more damage than your other 5 runes combined.

I was approaching it the other way: With a support with a spammable shield, and overheal and bloodthirster etc....The rune could be procced a few times a minute. Probably 100 times in a longer game. If it gave an average of 25 damage each time... that's 2500 damage against champions from the rune throughout the game. (With a chance for some much larger hits, by using Locket, for example.)

I don't think that ranged champions who go sorcery secondary will switch over either... You have to be consistently be regaining and losing the shield to get any use out of Shield Bash since it requires a NEW shield to proc it. On an ADC it may not be worth taking, considering you don't want to be hit in the first place and therefore will never lose the shield and proc the rune again (at least not as frequently as a melee fighter will).

We might see another iteration of the Duo Relic Shield Bottom lane... Shield Bash might make it more attractive. Last year, increased damage wasn't even a factor...
